meanings.definition: Not established or recognized as valid or authoritative.
meanings.sent1: The unestablished theory was not widely accepted by scientists.
meanings.sent2: The new company was unestablished and struggled to attract customers.
meanings.sent3: The unestablished idea seemed too far-fetched to be taken seriously.
meanings.sent4: Her unestablished reputation made it difficult for her to find a job.
meanings.sent5: The unestablished law caused confusion among the citizens.

meanings.definition: Not having a firm or permanent position or status.
meanings.sent1: The unestablished employee was still on probation.
meanings.sent2: The unestablished tent blew away in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: His unestablished role in the play led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The unestablished relationship between the two countries was fragile.
meanings.sent5: The unestablished structure collapsed under its own weight.
